text.text: Working with Charges categories

text: Charge rates are entered on the Charges tab under Settings and departmentalized into groups called categories. Categories are a grouping of rates for a specific purpose. For charges that differ from the Universal rates ( your default rates ) , create a new category. You can have as many categories as you need.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=xz4vz0ura6

text.text: How to work with charge categories?

text: To work with charge categories, you can: 1. Click the Charges tab under Settings. 2. Click the View field and select the category you want to edit. 3. Click Edit. 4. Add or change rates as needed. 5. Click Save.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=xz4vz0ura6

text.text: help me work with charges categories

text: To work with charge categories, you can: 1. Click the Charges tab under Settings. 2. Click the View field and select the category you want to edit. 3. Click Edit. 4. Add or change rates as needed. 5. Click Save.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=xz4vz0ura6

text.text: Ignoring a Claim on a Facility Invoice

text: When you ignore a claim on a facility invoice, the charge and new balance remains the same. The claim on the invoice is ignored. There is no notification or indication on the facility invoice that a claim was dropped. The claim will not display under the "Previously Invoiced Claim Summary".
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=b5m2qc0mtu

text.text: Explain facility billing?

text: Facility billing is an agreement with a facility for a dollar amount that the facility will reimburse your company for services, supplies, and procedures. This is different from charge rates.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=zq9lkfn31i

text.text: How to fix an incorrect facility charge?

text: To fix an incorrect facility charge, you can: 1. Go to the Claim page for the submitted claim. 2. Click the Charges tab and then click the edit icon. 3. Update the charge(s) on the Claim page. 4. Click Save changes. 5. Click Resubmit to payer. 6. Click the Facilities on the top navigation bar. 7. Click the Queued claims tab. Your newly edited claim will display in this tab. 8. Click the edit icon next to the 'Invoice period' field and select the correct date. 9. Click Generate invoice. A new invoice will display with the updated charge information.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=hlsxcylp49

text.text: How to invoice outstanding balance?

text: To invoice outstanding balance, you can: 1. Click the With outstanding balances tab. 2. This list shows the facility information, any new charges, and the outstanding balance. 3. Note: The "New charges" column shows new charges that have not yet been invoiced. 4. If you want to send an invoice for only the new charges, click the With new charges tab.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=2wu3qwpf0s

text.text: How to invoice outstanding balance?

text: To invoice outstanding balance, you can: 1. Click the With outstanding balances tab. 2. This list shows the facility information, any new charges, and the outstanding balance. 3. Note: The "New charges" column shows new charges that have not yet been invoiced. 4. If you want to send an invoice for only the new charges, click the With new charges tab.

text.text: What is PCS-Part 2

text: The Physician Certification Statement (PCS) is the written order certifying the medical necessity of non-emergency ambulance transports. You can use ZOLL Billing to: - Add a PCS during claim creation or afterwords on the Claim page (edit "Incident details" tab). - Hover over Claims and click Authorizations to view a list of PCS and non-PCS, as well as their attachments, on file for all patients. - Go to the patient's Account page > Coordination of Benefits tab to view all the PCSs on file for this patient.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=4gybbygyz7

text.text: How to set up diagnosis favorites?

text: To set up diagnosis favorites, you can either manually create a list or import a list. To manually create a list, you can click the "Diagnosis favorites" tab and enter a partial description or the ICD-10 code. You can also add a nickname to the code. To import a list, you can click the "Import favorites" button and upload the file. You can also change the copied ICD-10 diagnosis codes to anything you want.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=f6fj0yksql

text.text: Explain ICD-10 Expiration Dates?

text: As ICD-10 expires codes, they will no longer be available in ZOLL Billing. If you have an ICD-10 code that was valid for the date of service of your claim and you change the date of service to one where the ICD-10 code is no longer valid, it will not display in ZOLL Billing.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=up4i0i1p9w

text.text: How to Change the primary payer after payment?

text: To change the primary payer after payment, you can follow these steps: 1. Enter the claim number in the search bar and then click the claim number in the search results. 2. Click the COB tab. 3. Select the payer type and then click the radio button under the Primary payer box. 4. Click Save changes.
For more information click this : https://help.zollonline.com/billing/Content/Videos.htm?wchannelid=m8t21u1viq&wmediaid=mez18bi5ct
